{include "default_salutation"} –

It's time to roll up our sleeves.

We're calling for volunteers to help stop Gov. Ricketts' new prison scheme.

Take Action

This summer's headlines show what's at stake.

Two more Nebraska prison facilities just went into staffing emergencies, bringing the total to four. A new report says staffing "routinely" hits crisis levels. Imprisoned Nebraskans face restricted access to programming, educational opportunities, and even psychiatric care. And the staff are required to work long hours, away from families and loved ones.

We cannot even adequately staff the prisons we already have, but Gov. Ricketts keeps pushing for a massive new prison.

The good news is that the decision doesn't belong to him; it's up to our state senators. Will you help us make sure they know the answer is investing in people, not prisons?

Request an advocacy toolkit mailed directly to your home or express interest in joining our new prison fight advisory team.

{include "first_name"}, the actions we take today will define our smart justice opportunities for the next decade. Together, we can urge our lawmakers to stop doubling down on mass incarceration and racial injustice and instead invest in our communities and real public safety solutions.

Let's get started.

In Freedom and Friendship,
